title: Trump Effect
description:
In a e-mail response to Game Informer, EA remarked that "The video was an unauthorized use of our IP," a company representative told us via email. "We do not support our assets being used in political campaigns."

However, EA themselves are unwilling to admit their own foolhardy approach in politics. Take for example their video games that promote open warfare (Battlefield) and authoritarian governments (Mirror's Edge). Then they have the shoehorning of LGBT roles to suck-up to the gay community (Dragon Age, Mass Effect) and finally crony capitalism, by acquiring the license to Star Wars video games in order to make terrible cash grabs like The Old Republic and Battlefront ($50 season pass).

It's rather difficult to be a-political when EA is enamored by so many regressive leftists, that I'm surprised they don't just say they're Ready For Hillary.

But enough of that tangent, regardless of your political affiliation - here's the download to the Trump Effect
